What would be even better is the sendfile system call, which does it entirely in kernel space. If would be terrific if @rohan100jain was able to implement that when src and dst are Unix FS, and do streaming otherwise.

body: Slurping the whole file into memory and writing it back out isn't exactly optimal. Streaming would be great. What would be even better is the [`sendfile`](http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/sendfile.2.html) system call, which does it entirely in kernel space. If would be terrific if @rohan100jain was able to implement that when src and dst are Unix FS, and do streaming otherwise.
